_header: Almighty and merciable Queen / To whom all the world
Note:
Inserted in the prose translation of Deguileville’s Pélerinage de la vie humaine in six MSS: see below. In Lydgate’s verse translation in MS London, British Library Cotton Vitellius C.XIII a space is left at ff. 255-56 for the ABC: see 6850; Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 126; also ed. Speght (1602)
XSpeght, Thomas. The Workes of…Geffrey Chaucer. London, [A. Islip,] imp. G. Bishop, 1598; rev. ed. A. Islip, 1602 (STC 5077, 5080), and many others.
_description: Chaucer, ABC hymn to the Virgin — twenty-three 8-line stanzas

Almighty & almercyable queneTo whom all this world fleith for
                    socor…
Bod638.Last Lines:
…Bringe os to that paleis that is bilteTo penitentis that ben
                    to mercy abull

CamStJohn189.First Lines:
Almyghty and alle mercyable QueneTo wham alle this werlde flees
                    ffor Socour…
CamStJohn189.Last Lines:
…And brynge vs to thy place þat es biltTo Penitence
                    þat to thy mercy are able
CamStJohn189.Note:
Twenty-three 8-line stanzas, ababbcbc, mis-labeled with a red letter to
                    right of each four lines through f. 110, then labeled correctly thereafter
                    beginning ‘N’ at top f. 110v; inserted in the prose
                    translation of Deguileville’s Pélerinage de la vie
                    humaine.
